API docs by Redocly

Accounting API (1.0.0)

Download OpenAPI specification:

Lifestream Dynamics: support@lifestreamdynamics.com License: Proprietary

Bank-level secure REST API for universal accounting and financial operations.

Features

  • JWT authentication with refresh tokens
  • Role-based access control (6 roles)
  • Multi-tenant architecture with organization isolation
  • Comprehensive validation with express-validator
  • Audit logging for all operations
  • Stripe payment integration
  • File upload capabilities
  • Complex filtering and pagination

Security

This API implements bank-level security measures including:

  • End-to-end encryption
  • Rate limiting
  • CORS protection
  • Helmet security headers
  • Input validation and sanitization
  • Audit trail for all operations

Authentication

The API uses JWT tokens for authentication. Include the Bearer token in the Authorization header:

Authorization: Bearer <your-jwt-token>

Rate Limiting

API requests are rate-limited. See response headers for current limits:

  • X-RateLimit-Limit: Request limit per window
  • X-RateLimit-Remaining: Remaining requests in window
  • X-RateLimit-Reset: Time when window resets

Health

Health check endpoints

Authentication

User authentication and authorization

Register a new user

Creates a new user account with email verification. Registration requires organization invitation or valid organization domain for multi-tenant security.

Request Body schema: application/json
required
email
required
string <email>

User email address (must be unique)

password
required
string >= 8 characters ^(?=.*[a-z])(?=.*[A-Z])(?=.*\d)(?=.*[@$!%*?&]...

User password (min 8 chars, must include uppercase, lowercase, number, special char)

firstName
required
string [ 2 .. 50 ] characters

User's first name

lastName
required
string [ 2 .. 50 ] characters

User's last name

organizationId
required
string

Organization ID to join

invitationCode
string

Invitation code (required for some organizations)

role
string
Enum: "VIEWER" "EMPLOYEE" "ACCOUNTANT" "MANAGER" "ADMIN"

Requested role (subject to approval)

phone
string

Phone number for 2FA and notifications

timezone
string

User's timezone

Responses

Development server

http://localhost:3000/api/v1/auth/register

Production server

https://api.accounting.com/api/v1/auth/register

Request samples

  • Payload
Content type
application/json
{
  • "email": "john.doe@example.com",
  • "password": "SecurePass123!",
  • "firstName": "John",
  • "lastName": "Doe",
  • "organizationId": "clp1234567890",
  • "invitationCode": "INV-ABC123",
  • "role": "EMPLOYEE",
  • "phone": "+1-555-123-4567",
  • "timezone": "America/New_York"
}

Response samples

  • 201
Content type
application/json
{
  • "message": "User registered successfully. Please check your email for verification.",

}

Completes password reset process using the token received via email. The token is single-use and has limited validity.

required

required

newPassword
required
string >= 8 characters ^(?=.*[a-z])(?=.*[A-Z])(?=.*\d)(?=.*[@$!%*?&]...

New password (must meet security requirements)

confirmPassword
string

Password confirmation (must match newPassword)

Responses

Production server

Organizations

Organization management

Request domain ownership verification

Initiates the domain verification process for a new organization. Generates a unique CNAME record that must be added to the domain's DNS.

Master Organization Only: This endpoint requires SUPER_ADMIN role from lifestreamdynamics.com

Verification Process:

  1. Submit domain for verification
  2. Receive CNAME record to add to DNS
  3. Add record: _accounting-verify.domain.com CNAME token.verify.lifestreamdynamics.com
  4. Wait for DNS propagation (may take up to 24 hours)
  5. Call verification endpoint to confirm

Security: Prevents unauthorized organizations from claiming domains they don't own

Authorizations:
bearerAuth
Request Body schema: application/json
required
domain
required
string^[a-zA-Z0-9][a-zA-Z0-9-]{1,61}[a-zA-Z0-9]\.[a...

Domain name to verify (without www or protocol)

Responses

Development server

http://localhost:3000/api/v1/organizations/verify-domain

Production server

https://api.accounting.com/api/v1/organizations/verify-domain

Request samples

  • Payload
Content type
application/json
{
  • "domain": "newclient.com"
}

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "domain": "newclient.com",
  • "verificationToken": "accounting-verify-abc123def456",
  • "cnameRecord": "_accounting-verify.newclient.com CNAME accounting-verify-abc123def456.verify.lifestreamdynamics.com",
  • "instructions": "string",
  • "expiresAt": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z",
  • "status": "PENDING"
}

Verify domain ownership via DNS

Performs DNS lookup to verify the CNAME record has been added correctly. Uses multiple DNS resolvers (Google, Cloudflare, Quad9) for redundancy.

Master Organization Only: This endpoint requires SUPER_ADMIN role from lifestreamdynamics.com

What it checks:

  • DNS CNAME record exists at _accounting-verify.domain.com
  • Record value matches the expected verification token
  • Uses multiple DNS servers to prevent spoofing
  • Verification token has not expired

After verification:

  • Domain status changes to VERIFIED
  • Domain can be used to create new organization
  • Audit log entry created
Authorizations:
bearerAuth
path Parameters
domain
required
string
Example: newclient.com

Domain name to verify

Responses

Development server

http://localhost:3000/api/v1/organizations/verify-domain/{domain}/verify

Production server

https://api.accounting.com/api/v1/organizations/verify-domain/{domain}/verify

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "verified": true,
  • "recordFound": true,
  • "expectedValue": "accounting-verify-abc123def456.verify.lifestreamdynamics.com",
  • "actualValue": "accounting-verify-abc123def456.verify.lifestreamdynamics.com",
  • "timestamp": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z",
  • "nameservers": [
    • "8.8.8.8",
    • "1.1.1.1"
    ]
}

bearerAuth

required
type
required
string

Customer service tier

status
string (CustomerStatus)
Enum: "PROSPECT" "ACTIVE" "INACTIVE" "SUSPENDED"

Customer account status

creditLimit
number <decimal>

Customer credit limit

paymentTerms
integer

Payment terms in days

taxExempt
boolean
Default: false

Tax exemption status

preferredCurrency
string (Currency)
Enum: "CAD" "USD" "EUR" "GBP"

ISO 4217 currency code

notes
string

Internal notes

object

object

Business details (required if type is BUSINESS)

required

required
string

string [ 10 .. 2000 ] characters

Detailed notes about the appointment

actualDuration
integer >= 1

Actual duration in minutes

boolean
Default: false

Whether follow-up is required

string <date>

Suggested follow-up date

Array of strings

List of next steps or action items

number <float> >= 0

Billable hours for this appointment

Array of objects

Expenses incurred during appointment

clientSatisfaction
integer [ 1 .. 5 ]

Client satisfaction rating (1-5)

Array of objects

Payments

Payment processing

Handle Stripe webhook events

Processes Stripe webhook events for payment status updates. This endpoint does not require authentication as it uses Stripe's signature validation for security. Handles payment intents status changes, automatic invoice updates, and payment reconciliation.

Security Features:

  • Webhook signature validation using Stripe's signing secret
  • Request payload verification and timestamp checking
  • Idempotency handling for duplicate events
  • Secure processing of payment status changes

Supported Webhook Events:

  • payment_intent.succeeded: Payment completed successfully
  • payment_intent.payment_failed: Payment failed
  • payment_intent.requires_action: Additional action required
  • payment_intent.canceled: Payment was canceled
  • charge.dispute.created: Chargeback/dispute initiated
Request Body schema: application/json
required
id
string

Stripe event ID

object
string
Value: "event"
type
string

Webhook event type

object

Responses

Development server

http://localhost:3000/api/v1/payments/webhook/stripe

Production server

https://api.accounting.com/api/v1/payments/webhook/stripe

Request samples

Create a manual payment record

Creates a manual payment record for cash, check, bank transfer, or other non-Stripe payment methods. Automatically updates related invoice status and handles payment allocation. Requires Admin, Manager, Accountant, or Employee role.

Payment Processing Workflow:

  • Validates payment method and amount against invoice
  • Creates payment record with transaction reference
  • Updates invoice status (PAID if full payment, PARTIAL if partial)
  • Generates audit trail for payment transaction
  • Handles currency conversion if needed
  • Calculates and records processing fees

Supported Payment Methods:

  • CASH: Physical cash payments
  • CHECK: Bank checks with check number
  • BANK_TRANSFER: Wire transfers and ACH
  • CREDIT_CARD: Manual card processing
  • PAYPAL: PayPal transactions
  • OTHER: Custom payment methods

Security Measures:

  • Role-based access control
  • Payment amount validation
  • Transaction reference verification
  • Audit logging for compliance
Authorizations:

Create Stripe payment intent

Creates a Stripe payment intent for credit card processing. This enables secure card payments through Stripe's payment gateway with PCI compliance. Requires Admin, Manager, Accountant, or Employee role.

Stripe Integration Features:

  • Creates secure payment intent with client secret
  • Supports 3D Secure authentication when required
  • Handles payment method attachment and confirmation
  • Automatic webhook processing for status updates
  • PCI compliant payment processing
  • Multi-currency support through Stripe

Payment Flow:

  1. Create payment intent with invoice metadata
  2. Return client secret for frontend processing
  3. Customer completes payment on frontend
  4. Stripe webhook confirms payment status
  5. Invoice status automatically updated

Security & Compliance:

  • PCI DSS Level 1 compliance through Stripe
  • No sensitive card data stored locally
  • Secure payment intent validation
  • Fraud detection and prevention
  • Transaction monitoring and alerts
Authorizations:
bearerAuth

  • Audit trail creation for compliance

Process payment refund

Initiates a refund for a completed payment. Supports both full and partial refunds with automatic accounting adjustments and customer notifications. Requires Admin or Manager role.

Refund Processing:

  • Validates refund eligibility and amount
  • Processes refund through payment gateway (Stripe) or marks for manual processing
  • Updates payment status to REFUNDED (full) or creates separate refund record (partial)
  • Adjusts invoice status and remaining balance
  • Creates accounting entries for refund transaction
  • Triggers customer notification workflows

Refund Types:

  • Full Refund: Complete refund of original payment amount
  • Partial Refund: Refund of specific amount less than original payment
  • Stripe Refund: Automatic processing through Stripe gateway
  • Manual Refund: Marked for manual processing (cash, check, etc.)

Business Impact:

  • Invoice status updates (PAID → REFUNDED/PARTIAL)
  • Accounting reconciliation entries
  • Customer relationship management
  • Financial reporting adjustments
  • Compliance and audit trail creation

Security & Authorization:

  • Restricted to Admin and Manager roles only
  • Refund reason requirement for audit compliance
  • Multi-step approval workflow for large refunds
  • Comprehensive audit logging
  • Fraud prevention checks
Authorizations:
bearerAuth

id
required
string
Example: pay_1234567890

Update cheque payment status

Updates the status of a cheque payment as it progresses through the clearing process, from received to cleared or bounced.

Authorizations:
bearerAuth
path Parameters
paymentId
required
string
Example: clp1234567890

Payment ID of the cheque

Request Body schema: application/json
required
status
required
string
Enum: "RECEIVED" "DEPOSITED" "CLEARING" "CLEARED" "BOUNCED" "STOPPED" "CANCELLED"

New status of the cheque

statusDate
string <date-time>

Date and time of status change

object

Bank confirmation details (for cleared status)

bounceReason
string
Enum: "INSUFFICIENT_FUNDS" "ACCOUNT_CLOSED" "STOP_PAYMENT" "SIGNATURE_MISMATCH" "STALE_DATED" "OTHER"

Reason for bounce (if status is BOUNCED)

nsfFee
number <float>

NSF fee charged (if applicable)

notes
string <= 500 characters

Additional notes about the status change

notifyCustomer
boolean
Default: true

Whether to notify customer of status change

requiresFollowUp
boolean
Default: false

Whether this status requires follow-up action

followUpDate
string <date>

Date for follow-up action (if required)

object

Replacement payment details (for bounced cheques)

Detect fraud alerts

Analyzes payment patterns and transactions to identify potential fraudulent activities, suspicious behavior, and security risks for proactive fraud prevention.

Authorizations:
bearerAuth
query Parameters
period
string
Default: "week"
Enum: "day" "week" "month"

Time period for fraud detection analysis

startDate
string <date>

Start date for analysis (YYYY-MM-DD)

endDate
string <date>

End date for analysis (YYYY-MM-DD)

severityLevel
string
Default: "MEDIUM"
Enum: "LOW" "MEDIUM" "HIGH" "CRITICAL"

Minimum severity level to include

alertTypes
Array of strings
Items Enum: "UNUSUAL_AMOUNT" "RAPID_FREQUENCY" "GEOGRAPHIC_ANOMALY" "TIME_ANOMALY" "PAYMENT_METHOD_ABUSE" "DUPLICATE_DETECTION"

Specific types of fraud alerts to check

includeResolved
boolean
Default: false

Whether to include previously resolved alerts

customerId
string

Focus analysis on specific customer

Get field template for specific category

Returns the complete field template for a specific service category. Use this to dynamically generate form fields based on the selected category.

No authentication required

Each field includes:

  • Field type (text, select, number, etc.)
  • Validation rules (required, min, max, pattern)
  • Options for select/radio fields
  • Conditional display rules (showIf)
  • Help text and placeholders

Initialize new intake session

Creates a new intake session and returns a token. The token must be included in the X-Intake-Token header for all subsequent requests.

No authentication required

Rate Limits:

  • 5 initializations per hour per IP address
  • Aggressive bot detection enabled

Session Duration: 48 hours

Request Body schema: application/json
fingerprint
string

Optional browser fingerprint for enhanced security

Responses

Update intake session data

Submit customer or quote data for the current step. Data can be submitted piecemeal - you don't need to complete everything at once.

Requires X-Intake-Token header

Rate Limits:

  • 10 updates per minute per IP address
  • 50 total updates per session lifetime
  • Bot detection on every request

Workflow Steps:

  1. EMAIL_CAPTURE - Submit email address
  2. PROFILE_TYPE - Select RESIDENTIAL or COMMERCIAL
  3. PROFILE_DETAILS - Provide contact info and address
  4. SERVICE_CATEGORY - Select service category
  5. SERVICE_DETAILS - Provide service details
  6. ADDITIONAL_INFO - Optional additional information
  7. REVIEW - Review all data
  8. SUBMIT - Final submission (use /submit endpoint)
Authorizations:
IntakeToken
Request Body schema: application/json
required
step
required
string
Enum: "EMAIL_CAPTURE" "PROFILE_TYPE" "PROFILE_DETAILS" "SERVICE_CATEGORY" "SERVICE_DETAILS" "ADDITIONAL_INFO" "REVIEW"
object

Customer information (residential or commercial)

object

Quote/service request information

privacyConsent
boolean
termsConsent
boolean
marketingConsent
boolean

Responses

Development server

http://localhost:3000/api/v1/public/intake/step

Production server

https://api.accounting.com/api/v1/public/intake/step

Rate Limits:

Submit intake and create customer/quote

Finalize the intake process and create actual Customer and Quote records. This is the final step that converts temporary intake data to permanent records.

Requires X-Intake-Token header

Rate Limits:

  • 2 submissions per hour per IP address
  • 1 submission per session (single-use)
  • Maximum bot detection security

Requirements:

  • All mandatory customer fields completed
  • All mandatory quote fields completed
  • Privacy policy and terms accepted
  • Session must be in ACTIVE status

After Submission:

  • Session marked as COMPLETED
  • Customer and Quote records created
  • Confirmation email sent
  • Internal team notified
Authorizations:
IntakeToken
Request Body schema: application/json
required
organizationId
required
string

Organization ID to associate the customer and quote with

Responses

Development server

http://localhost:3000/api/v1/public/intake/submit

Production server

https://api.accounting.com/api/v1/public/intake/submit

Request samples

application/json
{
  • "organizationId": "org_1234567890abcdef"
}

Domain Verification

Request domain ownership verification

Initiates the domain verification process for a new organization. Generates a unique CNAME record that must be added to the domain's DNS.

Master Organization Only: This endpoint requires SUPER_ADMIN role from lifestreamdynamics.com

Verification Process:

  1. Submit domain for verification
  2. Receive CNAME record to add to DNS
  3. Add record: _accounting-verify.domain.com CNAME token.verify.lifestreamdynamics.com
  4. Wait for DNS propagation (may take up to 24 hours)
  5. Call verification endpoint to confirm

Security: Prevents unauthorized organizations from claiming domains they don't own

Authorizations:
bearerAuth
Request Body schema: application/json
required
domain
required
string^[a-zA-Z0-9][a-zA-Z0-9-]{1,61}[a-zA-Z0-9]\.[a...

Domain name to verify (without www or protocol)

Responses

Development server

http://localhost:3000/api/v1/organizations/verify-domain

Production server

https://api.accounting.com/api/v1/organizations/verify-domain

Request samples

  • Payload
Content type
application/json
{
  • "domain": "newclient.com"
}

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "domain": "newclient.com",
  • "verificationToken": "accounting-verify-abc123def456",
  • "cnameRecord": "_accounting-verify.newclient.com CNAME accounting-verify-abc123def456.verify.lifestreamdynamics.com",
  • "instructions": "string",
  • "expiresAt": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z",
  • "status": "PENDING"
}

  • "id": "string",

  • "status": "VERIFIED",
  • "verificationToken": "accounting-verify-abc123def456",
  • "attempts": 0,
  • "lastAttemptAt": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z",
  • "verifiedAt": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z",
  • "expiresAt": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z",
  • "createdAt": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z"
}

Verify domain ownership via DNS

Performs DNS lookup to verify the CNAME record has been added correctly. Uses multiple DNS resolvers (Google, Cloudflare, Quad9) for redundancy.

Master Organization Only: This endpoint requires SUPER_ADMIN role from lifestreamdynamics.com

What it checks:

  • DNS CNAME record exists at _accounting-verify.domain.com
  • Record value matches the expected verification token
  • Uses multiple DNS servers to prevent spoofing
  • Verification token has not expired

After verification:

  • Domain status changes to VERIFIED
  • Domain can be used to create new organization
  • Audit log entry created
Authorizations:
bearerAuth
path Parameters
domain
required
string
Example: newclient.com

Domain name to verify

Responses

Development server

http://localhost:3000/api/v1/organizations/verify-domain/{domain}/verify

Production server

https://api.accounting.com/api/v1/organizations/verify-domain/{domain}/verify

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
